column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022
column14: Completely plug-and-play. Installed on my 2020 Silverado 1500 in 2 minutes and now have wireless apple CarPlay. You can still plug your phone up to its charger and the device will maintain the existing wireless CarPlay connection without interrupting your CarPlay streaming. I updated the device per the instructions and that was easy as well.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
column14: I must admit that this thing works. It works well. But it uses wifi to communicate with your phone even though bluetooth is enabled as well. As a result your phone batter drains very rapidly. I spoke with a service rep and was just told I could plug my phone into another usb port to keep it charging. That, however defeated the purpose of getting the device in the first place- I didn't want to have to plug my phone in every time I got in my car. I decided to return it and just go back to plugging my phone in for Carplay. I really wanted it to work.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2022
column14: Just got a 2019 Ford Escape with Sync 3 and was disappointed that it didn't Android Auto. I was surprised when I saw this and it was able to do Wireless Android Auto just how I want it. I only use it for Google Maps, Tune-In Radio, Youtube Music, and Podcast Addict. Won't be using any of the video or gaming apps. But it's great for what I bought it for.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021
column14: My 2020 Acura mdx can be used, and the boot speed is very fast, almost 10 seconds. There is no delay in playing music. Great, recommended!!!!!

column14: I plugged this into my Ford F-150 and it immediately synced to my phone and I was up and running!  No issues whatsoever after a couple of weeks of daily use.
